principles.title: Make day status, signature, and locking explicit
principles.rationale: Compliance and trust require visible state transitions and immutable records after locking, with a transparent way to rectify mistakes without altering the original
principles.example: The UI clearly indicates signed and locked state and prevents accidental edits while offering a safe, auditable correction path that preserves the original record

antipatterns.name: Allowing edits after lock without a clear warning
antipatterns.why_harmful: Breaks audit trail and undermines integrity

antipatterns.name: Failing to provide feedback on data persistence
antipatterns.why_harmful: Creates anxiety about unsaved data, especially offline

principles.title: Guide and request in the moment, never block
principles.rationale: Professionals prefer just-in-time guidance and consent; requests should appear exactly when needed with a non-blocking recovery path
principles.example: On attaching a photo, request camera access with clear rationale and provide options to continue such as choose existing, open settings, or proceed without blocking the task

antipatterns.name: Permission prompts out of context
antipatterns.why_harmful: Drives denial and causes later broken flows

antipatterns.name: Empty states without a clear next action
antipatterns.why_harmful: Waste screen real estate and stall progress

principles.title: Honor WCAG AA, Dynamic Type, focus order, and target sizes
principles.rationale: Outdoor use and accessibility needs demand robust legibility and operability, improving accuracy and speed for everyone
principles.example: Forms maintain at least 44pt tap targets, valid focus order, scalable type, and sufficient contrast for bright conditions

antipatterns.name: Insufficient contrast or ignoring Dynamic Type
Using placeholders instead of labels
antipatterns.why_harmful: Labels vanish on input, harming comprehension and accessibility

principles.title: Minimize required input to reach value fast
principles.rationale: Lowering initial data burden accelerates Time-to-First-Project and activation; defer noncritical fields and support efficient repetition
principles.example: Create a project with essential minimum and accelerate routine input with repeat-friendly actions such as save-and-add-another or copy previous details

antipatterns.name: Overloaded project creation form
antipatterns.why_harmful: Cognitive overload delays activation and increases abandonment

antipatterns.name: Too many steps for repetitive entries
antipatterns.why_harmful: Inflates effort for routine logs and harms flow

principles.title: Offline is a first-class mode with graceful fallback
principles.rationale: Core flows must not block on network; auto-detect connectivity, accept manual inputs, queue work locally, and clearly signal status
principles.example: When online, weather can auto-populate; when offline, the app accepts manual values and confirms local save with later sync

antipatterns.name: Blocking core flows on network availability
antipatterns.why_harmful: Prevents field progress and forces error loops

antipatterns.name: Displaying network-dependent spinners or loaders
antipatterns.why_harmful: Encourages waiting on the network instead of progressing offline

principles.title: One screen — one key action
principles.rationale: Under time pressure, a single dominant goal per screen reduces cognitive load and navigation errors while preserving the shortest happy path
principles.example: Project Dashboard surfaces one primary CTA to continue daily work; secondary actions are visually subordinate

antipatterns.name: Combining unrelated tasks on one screen
antipatterns.why_harmful: Fragments attention and increases error risk in field use

antipatterns.name: Hiding the primary action behind menus

conflicts.tie_break: Collect only legally essential fields upfront; defer the rest with reminders
Never block on network; allow manual entry and backfill when online
Prefer clarity of the primary task; use progressive disclosure for learning
Integrity wins; corrections happen via auditable paths that preserve the original
Maintain WCAG AA even with minor performance trade-offs

open_questions: Is signer_name required alongside a drawn signature for legal sufficiency
Do we support Dynamic Type through largest sizes (e.g., XXXL) across all forms and calendars
What timeout, retry, and backoff do we use for weather fetch, and what are the minimum offline fields for manual entry
What SLO do we target for report generation with many photos, and what are the file naming and localization rules
What is the policy for pre-filling on save-and-add-another, and which fields auto-carry to the next entry or day
Which locales are in scope for MVP and what is the fallback language policy
What minimum tap target size do we guarantee for dense lists and calendars (e.g., at least 44pt)
What are offline media retention and storage-pressure behaviors (limits, warnings, purge policy)
What standard indicator language and visuals do we use for online, offline, and queued states

aliases.note: Prefer proactive guidance over post-factum errors
Clarify behavior for detection, manual input, and status signaling

acceptance_checklist: Each principle has priority and 1–2 explicit antipatterns
Antipatterns include severity, impact_area (enum), and refs (PRD/CJM/UserFlow/HIG/WCAG)
Registry is de-duplicated and deterministically sorted (severity → name) and presented in a scannable structure
Examples illustrate outcomes, not prescribe implementations
Locking and integrity patterns are explicit (immutability after lock; auditable correction path)
Markdown and JSON counts and IDs are consistent
